newsitem.title: UK: Biocompatibles sees 190 pct sales growth.
newsitem.headline: Biocompatibles sees 190 pct sales growth.

text.p: British health technology group Biocompatibles International Plc said on Wednesday it expected sales growth in 1997 to match that in 1996.
Last year, sales rose by 193 percent to 10.99 million stg.

Chairman Jeremy Curnock Cook told the group's annual meeting that "based on results to date, we expect that the rate of growth in turnover for the full year 1997 will be similar to that achieved in 1996."

Biocomaptibles shares have risen sharply this year in anticipation of a strong performance by its cardiovascular stents and contact lenses, which are made from special lubricious materials that produce little reaction with human tissues.
Curnock Cook said sales of stents, which are inserted to expand furred-up arteries in the heart, and related items "are substantially ahead of last year."
He said the company was "confident that sales of stents will begin to grow significantly in late 1997 and through 1998 once additional distribution arrangements have been finalised."
Curnock Cook told shareholders that the company was talking to U.S. health giant Johnson & Johnson Inc about marketing stents, with an announcement expected "in the next few weeks".
The company said sales of its Proclear range of contact lenses "have made good progress in all markets."
